reviews.review_msg: Industry veteran who takes sessional jobs. He's knowledgeable and is able to express himself well. This class is people's introduction to digital logic so many find it hard. His homework and tests and lab assignments are time consuming but should be fair and tests the full breath of the subject matter found in the lectures.
Good lecturer but does not take ownership of his class (whether he was allowed to or not is unknown). Approachable and helpful. Makes an effort to ensure the whole class understands his lecture.
no more than one unmarketable tomato ahh prof
the second she opened her mouth, I knew this class was cooked.

Rather have prof that doesn't teach well but gives easy exams than teaches fine but gives bad exams. It was not hard to do well people just expect to be coddled. But there was no catch on the exams and she did scale up. Just learn material independently and understand assignment questions.

i don't even know where to begin. Sent 10+ emails and she responsed with "to.9 tird t respond stop send mails"  (I copied and pasted her email here no joke). rude. careless. lazy. idek how sfu approved this prof to teach. you ask her " how do you simplify this?" she says " yes simplify" ?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!? idek bro GL if you have this prof

Why would you be required to score at least 50% on the lab and 50% on the test to pass the course? The course is already difficult enough, and the labs are time-consuming. Avoid this professor because she yaps and makes many strict rules for assignments and labs.

Sometimes they go on explaining things (rambling) but examples are probably the way to go in understand. REALLY fair exams cuz its all from homework or extra problem sets. Communication with the prof is a bit hard but once you get what shes saying its easy to follow along esp cuz she repeats herself a lot.

Fair marker and very lenient with assignments and deadlines. Nothing's a surprise on tests and she is very much available via email, doesn't take long to respond. The course itself is pretty tough that's why many people might blame the prof but you just have to put in the work yourself. VHDL was hard to learn but in eng no prof is good for coding.

I actually despise this professor so much, she made me fail out of engineering :(. Now I am in business, which is SO much better because I can actually UNDERSTAND the professors there. PLEASE AVOID HER!!!!
Cannot understand a work she says during lectures. She insists us to ask questions if we don't understand and people try but she doesn't answer them. Shows up late a lot too.
supposed to be very interesting and engaging class with majid :( should've taken it in summer
nobody can understand what she's trying to say

Get ready to not understand a single word in her class. She got the lectures from a previous prof, and just showed up to class, and endeavored to improvise. Extremely awful. You ask her a question, she answers something else. Just read on your own, the course is mainly logic so you can do fine.
great prof.
Kind and caring. I hope I will have the chance to take other courses with him.
I strongly recommend other students to take 252 with Ameer. I really enjoyed his class.
Great prof. Learned a lot from him.
Don't hesitate to take 252 if this guy teaches it again! Ameer is extremely knowledgeable and passionate. He's very nice and caring. You'll enjoy learning this tough course!
Ameer is extremely helpful. I went to his office hours before the final and kept asking questions for 3 hours! he was very helpful.
Prepared, caring and knowledgeable. He gives a lot of hints on future career and co-op opportunities in North America.
Finally! Someone qualified to teach this course. Labs and exams are tough though.

ENSC 252 is one of the hardest courses in the department with the highest failure rate. However, this didn't stop Prof. Abdelhadi from teaching the course properly. He's an amazing lecturer. I noticed that he won't let it go until you understand the topic; he'll explain in many different ways until you get it. I wish if he changed the labs though.

She is by far the most caring prof I have ever taken a class with. She remembers her students, calls them by their names, very helpful outside of the class even not on her office hours she is ready to be helpful in any topic,a general advice, personal problem to share, help with projects. I wish every prof was like her.The class is difficult though

ENSC 252 is a hard course and the midterms are hell (the year I took it the average on midterm 2 was 39% before the scale). Anita is a great lecturer and super helpful during labs and Paige is an awesome and approachable TA. Be prepared to a heck ton of work for just a decent grade because the course is that hard.
I love Anita. She's great.

Dr. Tino did a great job in a remote semester, lectures were clear and concise. She was available around the clock for help with labs and course content. She gave me great career advice as well. People complaining about the lab clearly didn't read through the lab or ask for help (TA, discussion boards, etc.).
Does not explain anything about lab.
The course is pretty difficult with weekly labs, assignment and pre lab assignments but she really does a good job in making students understand the course. Shes the best!

one of my all time favourite profs, she is not only smart and great at what she does, she explains concepts in understandable ways and cares about her students much more than others. you will definitely have to work for the labs, assignments, etc. and its not easy but she makes it fun. super funny and loves the raptors
Not a morning person. Dopest Prof tho.
Great professor!

Very chill, funny, and generally cool. Her lectures are great, but you will still need to read the textbook. That's more a reflection on the coursework than on her not teaching enough. I'd definitely take more classes with her.

Tends to rely heavily on the lecture content for exam material. Has weekly assigned readings that are used both in the lecture and lab components of the course. Fairly nice with the grading scheme, offering up a substantial part of your overall grade for just completing labs, readings, and assignments. Exams tend to be tricky but fair.
Well organized, cares about her students, and really funny! She brightens up the day and teaches some neat stuff

when a prof uses his power to ditch other profs that is unethical and trying to deflect his own incompetence. He should focus on your own courses. Prof thinks he is an expert in everything - NOT. Unreasonable demands - cooked up labs and no input. Students just use YouTube and you will learn more and find old exams on course hero.

The course is not even that difficult it just purely the prof that makes it difficult with nonsense requirements in a rude manner. Like a lot of and very little unimportant points you should pay attention while submitting your work. He is by far the most rude professor I have seen. Discourages you in every way and rejects helping. Avoid at all cost

Not like other CS lectures, the prof makes their best effort like video/audio recording of the lecture, give out all notes to help you learn things. He give no note other than you write it yourself. Moreover, he writes the assignments, projects unclear to students, even to himself. You will need to spend hours to know what he want you to do.
He should not teach... I have never seen a prof that provided no solution through the entire semester. Also he didn't respect his student at all. Please get rid of him to make SFU engineering better.

The only Prof that's stayed with me, and other students wanting to learn, in the lab until after midnight to help us with problems before the midterm. He has high expectations for engineering students, as he should, and shows it. If you put in real effort in his classes you'll see he's truly a great prof, and does care about his students
Avoid him if you can.
Pretentious  and unprofessional
Horrible

Thinks he's some kind of genius but he's not. He says the world (books, internet, etc.) is wrong but his lectures/methods are correct. Lecture notes are filled with useless stuff but that's most of the material he uses on his exams.
THeee worst.
not helpful at all, wastes time during lecture. His assignments dont prepare you for exams at all. You can do poorly in class despite doing massive amount of work.

Does not help his students. No office hour, no solution, and avoids students questions. Surprisingly, questions are not encouraged. Even when students' questions attempted to be answered, they don't really answer it at all. The instructor needs to put some effort into answering student questions.
Horrible, avoid him because he's not a fair grader.
Come to his office or hang out with him then he'll tell you questions that will be on exam, which is unfair to rest of class.
Grading is based off how he feels about the student not actual performance.

He needs to be fair when giving out grades to students. That being said, SFU student evaluation has an impact on his salary so be careful when rating him.  Overall he's not that bad but very tough on grading.
The notes have random material (most of which is not helpful). Notes are a complete mess and posts them last second before lecture.
Yells at students for asking questions. Discourages all questions because he doesent understand them.

This is the prof that turns boys into men.  This is a second-year engineering course, and he expects you to act like it.  He is difficult, but very fair.  He is very approachable, and incredibly knowledgeable.    He takes a lot of time to get to know his students and help them out.
One of the only profs that actually makes u learn
Terrible prof, discourages ppl to graduate.
Cannot understand why SFU hires this guy as an instructor. No office hours, no homework and exams solutions, empty lecture notes. The worst prof ever had at SFU.
Too bad, the worst course I've ever take
Not so bad. He is a wise professor. Actually I got a B at last.
He's not nearly as funny as he thinks he is. Doesn't post ANY sample problems, or solutions to his exams/assignments. Expects you to know every single thing ever, and takes forever to finish marking

Lectures -  Okayish, but not really helpful Labs - He freaking interrogates you, and doesnt help whatsoever Tests - Out of Nowhere Overall - His class average 57%, minimum marks to get a C-, 58%. Can you believe it?? Also not scaled Homework/pre labs - waay too much work for too little marks AVOID IF YOU WANT TO KEEP YOUR SANITY!!!
Prepare to self-study if you take this course.

Prof only cares to make our life miserable. He's rude, unhelpful, funny (if you are not the target), and assumes you know some of this stuff already. Questions are discouraged and he questions the 'wisdom' and 'knowledge' of questions.

He's a entertaining teacher who can keep you engaged in his lectures. Unfortunately, he usually answers your questions with another question in order for you to figure out the answer on your own.  Reading the textbook is very important for this course. But overall, he does care for his students by helping them develop good study habits

I understand why some students don't like him, but here's the thing - be mature and thoughtful with everything. He makes jokes all the time often at the expense of what students have said. Think before you ask questions. He is very intelligent and knowledgeable and he answers questions with detail. If you're in engineering, get used to him.
